senses.de: Something that a country, organization, or person has which they can use.
senses.ex: The library has excellent learning resources.

Tips.title: Versatile Usage
Tips.description: The term can apply to a wide variety of useful things, from water to wisdom.
Tips.example: Her extensive travel experience was a valuable resource for the team.

Tips.title: Abstract or Concrete
Tips.description: 'Resource' can refer to something tangible like oil, or intangible like skills.
Tips.example: The company considers its skilled workforce to be its greatest resource.

Tips.title: Positive Connotation
Tips.description: Often implies an advantageous or beneficial quality.
Tips.example: Bilingual employees are seen as a resource in international business.

senses.de: In business, this refers to materials or qualities such as time and manpower which an organization has available to use.
senses.ex: The project was successful because we managed our resources well.

Tips.title: Business Efficiency
Tips.description: Emphasizes the importance of using what's available effectively.
Tips.example: Resource planning is essential for a startup's success.

Tips.title: Measurement of Wealth
Tips.description: Can indicate an organizational measure of assets and capabilities.
Tips.example: The entrepreneur grew his business by wisely investing his limited resources.

Tips.title: Scarce and Valuable
Tips.description: Implies that careful use and management are crucial for sustainability.
Tips.example: The drought made us realize the value of water as a precious resource.

senses.de: In computing, a resource is any physical or virtual component of limited availability within a computer system.
senses.ex: We need to upgrade our resources to handle the increased demand.

Tips.title: Technology Dependence
Tips.description: Highlights the reliance of technology on available resources.
Tips.example: Running the new software requires more memory, a vital computer resource.

Tips.title: Not Just Hardware
Tips.description: Can refer to software and services, not just physical equipment.
Tips.example: Cloud storage is an important online resource for data backup.

senses.de: An ability to find quick and clever ways to overcome difficulties.

Tips.title: Clever Solutions
Tips.description: Implies using existing assets or skills in innovative ways.
Tips.example: When lost in the woods, his knowledge of the stars became a vital resource.

Tips.title: Personal Qualities
Tips.description: Can describe internal, personal abilities or traits.
Tips.example: His sense of humor is an incredible resource during stressful times.

Aid.wordDefinition:
Aid refers to any kind of assistance that helps someone in need.

It can be in the form of material goods, money, or physical support. For example, a first aid kit can provide aid in case of an emergency.

Aid is specifically about providing help or support whereas resource is anything that can be used to address or solve a problem.

Asset.wordDefinition:
An asset is something that has value and is owned by an individual, organization or government.

In simpler terms, an asset is a valuable possession or property, while a resource is something that can be used to achieve a desired outcome.

For example, a building is an asset owned by a company, while the knowledge and skills of its employees are resources that can be utilized to achieve business objectives.

Mean.wordDefinition:
Mean typically refers to being unkind or cruel to someone or something, while the word resource refers to something that can be used to achieve a goal or solve a problem.

Mean can describe a person's behavior, while resource is often used in the context of finding solutions or using available assets.

For example, a person might be mean to someone else by insulting them, but a company might use its resources to develop a new product.

Provision.wordDefinition:
Provision refers to something that is provided, like food or supplies.

Both words are applicable in different situations. For example, a shelter may provide provisions like food and clothing to homeless people.

Provision is used when referring to something that is given or provided, while resource is used when referring to something that can be used for a specific purpose.

Reserve.wordDefinition:
Reserve refers to the amount of a particular resource that can be accessed and used immediately. For example, a country may have a reserve of oil that it can use right now.

Resource refers to the whole amount of a particular substance that exists, whether or not it can be accessed and used. For example, a country may have a resource of oil that includes all of the oil reserves in the ground, even if they are not yet accessible or usable.

Reserve refers to the currently available amount of a substance, while resource refers to the total amount that exists.

Stock.wordDefinition:
Stock refers to the amount of something that is available at a particular time. For example, the stock of water in a reservoir.

Applicability depends on the context of the situation. Resource is applicable when talking about the potential for future use and availability, while stock is applicable when discussing the current quantity available for use.

If we talk about a company's stock, we are referring to the number of shares in the company that are available for purchase.

Supply.wordDefinition:
A resource refers to a source that can be used to accomplish something, while a supply refers to the amount of a resource that is available at a given time.

For example, water is a resource. The supply of water might be limited in a particular area, depending on the available sources of water and the current demand for it.

Similarly, oil is a resource. The supply of oil refers to the amount of oil that is available at any given time.

Supplies can be renewable, like solar energy, or non-renewable, like fossil fuels.

Both resources and supplies are important to consider when planning for the future and making decisions about how to use them wisely.

Wealth.wordDefinition:
A resource has value because it can be used to generate wealth.

Wealth is a stockpile of valuable resources or goods that can be used to fulfill human needs or desires.

Wealth can include money, property, stocks, and commodities.

Wealth can also be used to create more resources or goods.

A resource is something that is used to create wealth, while wealth is a stockpile of resources or goods that can be used to fulfill human needs or desires.

Resources can be things like oil or timber, while wealth can be things like money or property.

quotes.Text: There are a lot of things you can do in space, and space essentially is unlimited resources. We are climbing over ourselves here looking for the next source of energy. The universe has an unlimited source of energy.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quotes.Text: The world has not yet reached the point which, in my view, is an essential condition for the survival of our human species: access by all the peoples to the material resources of this planet.
quotes.Title: Statesman
quotes.Name: Fidel Castro

quotes.Text: You learn a lot in life but there are a lot of tools and resources in school that help you grow professionally and personally for whatever goal you may want to achieve.
quotes.Title: Puerto Rican Singer
quotes.Name: Bad Bunny

quotes.Text: Few men during their lifetime comes anywhere near exhausting the resources dwelling within them. There are deep wells of strength that are never used.
quotes.Title: American Explorer
quotes.Name: Richard E. Byrd

quotes.Text: I see children, all children, as humanity's most precious resource, because it will be to them that the care of the planet will always be left.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Alice Walker

quotes.Text: My favorite things in life don't cost any money. It's really clear that the most precious resource we all have is time.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Steve Jobs

quotes.Text: Children are the world's future, and we need to take care of them like we would any precious resource.
quotes.Title: Jamaican Musician
quotes.Name: Ziggy Marley

quotes.Text: I was not raised with wealth or resources or any social standing to speak of.
quotes.Title: American First Lady
quotes.Name: Michelle Obama

quotes.Text: The state knows best how to protect resources.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Joni Ernst

quotes.Text: An actor's resource base must be life itself.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Shabana Azmi
